Re: License #: CB630201258
Dear Ms. Sykes:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
12/19/2023. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Pinkey Brown, Licensing Consultant
Pontiac, MI 48342
brownp2@michigan.gov
(248) 860-3012

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
The facility was not in need of technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
The facility did not require or request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was reviewed and discussed. The agency
did not have a Corrective Action plan for 2022. The Chief Administrator reported
they are working to address systemic delays to complete timely permanency for
children eligible for adoption. It was reported that the agency is experiencing 6-9
2

months consent delays for competing parties which accounts for approximately
12% of the agency current cases. It was reported that the agency continues to
center their efforts on the unique needs each child presents and to work with
partner agencies on trends developing upstream on the child welfare services
continuum.
Financial Overview
The agency annual audit by an independent certified public accountant and the
agency annual budget was reviewed. There were no concerns noted.
Staff Interviews
Two adoption staff were interviewed. They reported being satisfied with their
positions at the agency. Their supervisor is available, supportive, and
knowledgeable. Co-workers are supportive with one another. The staff reported
over the past year there have been some difficult changes, but everyone worked
well together to be successful. Staff did not have any concerns or suggestions for
improvement.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency continues to be located in the same office building as the 2022
review. The office continues to have adequate space for staff and clients. There is
sufficient locked storage for confidential information.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
Not applicable. This agency provides adoption services only.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
01/09/2024
Pinkey Brown Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
January 10, 2024
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
